These clinical features and CT findings in 2019-nCoV-infected children may overlap with those infected with other corona viruses: Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) and severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS). 10 but the exact origin and intermediate hosts have yet to be determined. Ground-glass opacities involving the peripheral lungs are the primary findings on CT. They were quite common findings on CT images; however, the consolidation sign, which was suggested as a marker of disease progression or more severe disease, was hardly shown in the CT images of 2019-nCoV-infected children.
